intro: Lahaya memphitica, commonly known as the Mexican spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as along stream banks and in wetlands. Lahaya memphitica has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and adaptability to various soil types.
